definition[0]: if a shop sells out of something, it has no more of that particular thing left to sell
example[1]: We’ve completely sold out of those shirts in your size, sir.
definition[1]: if products, tickets for an event etc sell out, they are all sold and there are none left
example[2]: Wow! Those cakes sold out fast.
example[3]: Tonight’s performance is completely sold out.
definition[2]: to change your beliefs or principles, especially in order to get more money or some other advantage – used to show disapproval
example[4]: ex-hippies who’ve sold out and become respectable businessmen
definition[3]: to sell your business or your share in a business
example[5]: Wyman says he’ll sell out if business doesn’t pick up.
example[6]: The T-mail Co. has sold out to San José-based DMX Inc for an undisclosed sum.
definition[4]: a performance, sports game etc for which all the tickets have been sold
example[7]: The concert was expected to be a sell-out.
definition[5]: a situation in which someone has not done what they promised to do or were expected to do by the people who trusted them
example[9]: a sellout of the poor for political reasons
definition[6]: someone who has not done what they promised to do or who is not loyal to their friends or supporters, especially in order to become more popular, richer etc
example[10]: Many black students regarded him as a sellout.
definition[7]: if an investor or owner of a company sells out, they sell their investments or the company
example[11]: Relations between the directors are strained, and shareholders have said they would like to sell out.
example[12]: They announced that they were selling out to a Japanese company.
definition[8]: if a shop sells out of a product, it has no more of that particular product left
example[13]: Some retailers had sold out of the new games console within twenty-four hours.
definition[9]: if a product, seats at an event, tickets for a journey etc sell out, there is none left
example[14]: First-class cabins are starting to sell out on some transcontinental flights.
definition[10]: if a product, share offer, event etc is a sell-out, it is very successful and lots of people buy it or go there, and no more products, shares, tickets etc are available
example[15]: The $200 million five-year bonds were an absolute sell-out.
